sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Christopher Morrison, March 2008

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Gabon on August 17, 1960, in a congratulatory message from President Dwight D. Eisenhower to Prime Minister Leon M’ba.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Gabon’s Independence, 1960.
div.p: The United States recognized Gabon on August 17, 1960, in a congratulatory message from President Dwight D. Eisenhower to Prime Minister Leon M’ba. On that date, Gabon’s independence from French Equatorial Africa was proclaimed.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations, 1960.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on August 17, 1960, when Alan W. Lukens (resident at Brazzaville) presented his credentials as Chargé d'Affaires ad interim.

div.head: Establishment of the American Embassy in Gabon, 1961.
div.p: Embassy Libreville was established on March 20, 1961, with Walker A. Diamanti as Chargé d'Affaires ad interim.
